name: Carsten Lutz
content: Carsten Lutz Prof. Dr. Carsten Lutz Visitors: Room P810, Paulinum, Augustusplatz 10 Tel.: ++49 341 97-32343 EMail: clu@informatik.uni-leipzig.de Universität Leipzig Fakultät für Mathematik und Informatik Institut für Informatik Augustusplatz 10 04109 Leipzig Abteilung Grundlagen der Wissensrepräsentation. For my publications, please see group publication list, DBLP, or Google scholar A Textbook on Description Logics Recent Activities PC Co-Chair of the International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR2026) PC Member of the 29th International Conference on Database Theory (ICDT2026) Senior PC member of the 40th Annual AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI2026) Area Chair of the 22nd International Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR2025) Area Chair of the 34th International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI2025) PC Member of the 44th Symposium on the Principles of Database Systems (PODS2025) PC Member of the 38th International Workshop On Description Logics (DL2025) Activities in previous years. Software systems that might be of interest: Grind (for computing FO-rewritings of ontology-mediated queries with EL-ontologies) Combo (implementing the combined approach to ontology-mediated querying with DL-Lite ontologies) Spell (SAT-based PAC learning of EL-concepts) I support reducing our conference travel CO2 footprint: I also like poems (which might or might not seem incompatible with having a position at a university). And, sometimes, quotes: "All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone." - Blaise Pascal
